scene.matchingInstructions: Match the items on the left to the correct areas on the right.

drops.drop: Over a four-year period in Hawaii, the average pH of precipitation was closest to the "normal" value.
Bananas have a pH value that is ten times stronger than the pH of "normal" rain.
Fog in Los Angeles had the most acidic pH value ever recorded for acid precipitation.
Baking soda can be added to pool water to raise the pH so that it is slightly above neutral. Therefore, soda ash has this pH value.
Precipitation that is less acidic than "normal" precipitation has this pH value.

scene.instructions: When you are done, check your results by clicking 'Check Answers.'

content.instruction: Click on the 'hot spots' to view additional information.

activity.text:
Other Chemical Properties




  • Toxicity
  • Flammability
  • Heat of Combustion
  • Reactivity

hotspots.hotspot: Toxicity is the degree to which a substance can harm living things. Arsenic is a naturally occurring element that can harm both plants and animals. Areas where this toxin occurs are usually barren of plants or animals.
Flammability is how easily a substance will burn. Gasoline is a very flammable substance, but water is very non-flammable.
The energy released as heat when a substance chemically reacts with oxygen to form carbon dioxide and water. When gasoline or wood burn in the presence of oxygen, a lot of heat is released.

Reactivity is how a particular substance reacts with another substance. For example, an important ingredient in antacids is calcium hydroxide. A chemical property of calcium hydroxide is that it reacts with the acids in your stomach.

scene.credits: (tr)Lauren Burke/Photographer's Choice RF/Getty Images, (bkgd)Image Source/Getty Images

multiple.question: In 2001, the pH of a lake was measured at 6.6. Measurements were taken again in 2011, and the pH had fallen to 4.6. Which of the following statements is true?

answers.answer: The water in the lake is now twice as acidic.
The decrease in pH means the lake is now 20 times less acidic.
The water in the lake is now 20 times more acidic.
The water in the lake is now 100 times more acidic.
The decrease in pH means the lake is more basic.

multiple.question: Which of the following illustrates a chemical property?

answers.answer: Aluminum is malleable, which means it can be hammered or pressed into a very thin sheet.
A solution of potassium iodide produces a yellow precipitate when it is mixed with a solution of lead nitrate.
Saltwater leaves a solid residue after the water has been boiled away.
Solid iodine crystals, which have a purple color, release a purplish gas when they are exposed to air.
The molecules of water move farther apart from one another as the liquid forms a gas.

multiple.question: What happens during any chemical reaction?

answers.answer: A new substance is produced.
The color changes.
A gas is produced.
Energy is absorbed.
Energy is released.
only physical properties.
only chemical properties.
both physical and chemical properties.
physical properties that undergo chemical changes.
chemical properties that cannot be observed.

multiple.question: Bromine is a red-brown liquid that has a density of 3.1 g/cm<sup>3</sup>. Bromine melts at 27°C and boils at 58.8°C. Bromine reacts with sodium metal to form a salt called sodium bromide. Sodium bromide is a white, crystalline solid. Which statement describes a chemical property of bromine?

answers.answer: Bromine boils at 58.8°C.
Bromine is a liquid.
Bromine has a density of 3.1 g/cm<sup>3</sup>.
Bromine has a melting temperature higher than that of water.
Bromine reacts with sodium to form a white, crystalline solid.
